long_description: The simple moving average computes the average over a number of points in a series.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the columns
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the columns

argument_clauses.name: TargetColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input column names for which the moving average is to be computed. If you omit this argument, then the function copies every input column to the output table but does not compute moving average.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column names for which the moving average is to be computed. If you omit this argument, then the function copies every input column to the output table but does not compute moving average.

argument_clauses.name: WindowSize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of previous values to include in the computation of the simple moving average. The default value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of previous values to include in the computation of the simple moving average. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: IncludeFirst
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to include the starting rows in the output table. The default value is 'false'. If you specify 'true', the output columns for the starting rows contain NULL, because their exponential moving average is undefined.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to include the starting rows in the output table. The default value is 'false'. If you specify 'true', the output columns for the starting rows contain NULL, because their exponential moving average is undefined.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
